medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began 1 day prior to presentation with sudden onset of emesis in the morning. Following that, the patient developed diffuse lower abdominal pain and experienced multiple episodes of emesis for 2 hours. After initial treatment, the abdominal pain and nausea returned shortly with radiation to the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Crohn's disease diagnosed in the past. Previous treatment included prednisone and mesalamine, but was discontinued after 1 year. No flare-ups requiring hospitalization.
